summary: This bill, the Fair Social Security for Domestic Violence Survivors Act, amends the Social Security Act to modify the 10-year marriage rule for eligibility for spouse and surviving spouse insurance benefits. It allows individuals who were victims of domestic violence during a marriage, as determined by a court of law, to qualify for benefits after 5 years of marriage instead of the usual 10 years.  It also addresses termination of benefits for divorced spouses in cases of domestic violence.
